name: coldcuts coldcuts
text: Outstanding customer service.  I was blown away at how he truly did everything he could to help me during a tough spot.  My family and I were traveling to Florida this past summer and had the transmission go out right south of Dothan on highway 230.  I started calling shops but of course it was Sunday.  Gary happened to be in his shop and answered.  Even though he was only there for a short errand, he waited for me to bring the car by.  Though he couldn't fix it right then, he called the local rental car agency and helped me get a rental.  I went on to Florida and he conducted diagnostics and held it for the whole week.  He offered straightforward advice on the repair.  I chose to sell the car since it was older.  He had it in enough working order for me to get it to a local dealer to sell it.  Through it all he answered many calls and went through much effort for virtually no money to help us out and save our vacation and I am extremely grateful.

text: We brought our Jeep into Transpro for a second opinion after being told from another dealership in town that we needed a new transmission. It ended up being 3 quarts low on transmission oil. There was a slow leak from the cap not being closed all the way. So instead of a $3,000 transmission fix, we spent $100 on transmission oil. Highly recommend this place. They take their time and inspect everything.

name: rtc
text:
Went in for new shocks and coils, they installed them well, but when I started driving, my vehicle constantly pulled to the left. If I didn't hold the steering wheel tight it would have flipped at high speeds. So I called them and they swore they had done an alignment. I asked if they'd check again to make sure it was done right and they begrudgingly said yes. Took it back in, they said everything looked great. I drove it off the lot and there was still a severe pull to the left. They blamed my tires and said it's because they had a bad wear pattern. (My tires were only a few months old).

So I took it to another place on the other side of the river. They did an alignment and told me that whoever had done my previous alignment lied to me. They showed me on a print out how the camber was over an inch out of line and how the toe of one wheel was turned too far in. I drove off the lot and my vehicle drove as straight as an arrow.

Bacon Alignment lied to me twice and charged me for something they didn't do. Avoid.

We do offer coupons and discounts, but we are ultimately known for quick and top-quality professional service. Thank you for your feedback.

text: I took all 5 of our vehicles to them for two years and all was great. For no reason other than to up-sale us, THE MANAGER began lying to my wife about what she needed. They did not reset the oil change counter and did not fill the wiper fluids - likely because my wife did not fall for their pitch. When I confronted him, he admitted to the lies and said he wouldn't do it again. Not acceptable. Moving on...

resp.text: We take your feedback very seriously and would appreciate the opportunity to further discuss your concerns. What you describe does not reflect our high standards of professional and honest service. We'd like the chance to learn more about your experience and in hopes of working towards your complete satisfaction. Please send your contact information and availability to reviews@fausaktire.com. Thank you.

name: Darrell Lindsey
text:
I have a 2012 Mercedes S550 and my Air Suspension Strut went out. I called World Class and had it towed in. They called me the next day, told me what was going on and gave me a quote. I promise you, they didn’t try to jack me up and tell me that other things were wrong, they just zeroed in on the problem and fixed it. I said that because I think all of us are looking for straight shooters who are not trying to get over on you... Now, because of high demand of car maintenance and everyone wanting their vehicle to be repaired, I had to wait a few days on my car; but it was explained to me upfront. And because of the excellent service and “Great Price,” it was worth the wait and I will be returning again for all of my future repairs!!! I highly recommend World Class because truly they are “World Class!!”
P.S. Brenden is a super nice guy with great customer service and has a “First Class Business!!!
Way to go World Class!!!!

text: I don't normally post reviews, but I feel compelled to pass along my excellent experience at World Class Auto. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and generally made the experience as enjoyable as possible. Additionally, the mechanic diagnosed and fixed my broken windshield washer pump without me evening mentioning the issue at first (compared to a certain service provider, who shall remain nameless, who wanted $300 to do it!). When you have time, please call (205) 591-7990. We hope to hear from you soon so we may work to resolve the issue. Thank you!

name: David Goodwin
text:
An amazing job with an older Mercedes 300CD!  It has essentially sat for a number years and the service and repair schedule needed to begin again.  They kept in constant contact as they uncovered areas that needed to be addressed with a full explanation and estimate of the work needed.
It was a great experience and and I'm very comfortable in recommending World Class Auto Repair.

resp.text: Good customers are like good cars...hard to find...and we both lucked up.  Thanks for the great review.

name: Jim Wilson
text: Excellent customer service always, great cost-savings, A+++ work!!!

name: John Markus
text: I have used World Class for several years and have been quite satisfied with the quality of the work and value received.  I trust them not to recommend more than I need and to perform any necessary repairs right the first time.  Also, the offer of a ride downtown and back makes the process very convenient.

name: Dwayne Carmichael
text: Do not take your vehicle to this place. I brought my BMW X5 there to have the water pump replaced. They replaced the water pump, but damaged other parts on my vehicle while doing the repair. I was quoted $360 labor to replace the water pump. I called to check on my vehicle later that evening, and Yvonne said that her technician was having a hard time installing the water pump and that they had to charge me an extra hour worth of labor. Who fault is that? I told them no way, so they only charged me the $360 that I was originally quoted. However they did mentioned that my car needed 2 more repairs and quoted me $563 for one and $440 for the other. The $440 repair was for a hose that was damaged while they were changing the pump. The hose cost $40 from the BMW dealership and they said it would be 4 hours of labor, which didn't sound right for a hose. I called 3 other independent shops and was quoted $130 for the same repair parts and labor. The $563 was for a hood latch and cable, the parts at dealer are $80. Yvonne also said it would be 4 hours labor. I called several independent shops and was quoted $200 for parts and labor. I guess 4 is there magic number. When I asked Yvonne to double check those quotes all of a sudden she wasn't able to find the labor rates in the system. How did she come up with those figures initially? Bottom line do not take your car to these ppl. Yvonne charges you whatever she feels like and that's not right.

resp.text: We remember you well.  You brought your car late one afternoon with a coolant leak,  and we drove you across town to take you home. You didn't mention that your hood latch was locked and would not open. We spent quite a while to opened the hood to replace the water pump that you brought for us to install, and you declined the hood repair knowing that it would not reopen once it was shut.  We actually charged less labor to install the water pump than the labor guide prescribes.  We also told you about another coolant leak that you say we caused, but we did not; you also declined that repair.  Yes, we would normally charge more because of the extra work to open your hood because of the latch and cable.  Your car came in with several problems, but none caused by us.  We did our best to accommodate you in every way and we're sorry you left dissatisfied.

name: Rico Suave
text: Dropped my car off for a radiator change. It took about a week to just get an estimate when I was told it would be looked at the following morning. When I finally got the estimate, it was on the high end, quoted a few more hours than normal. Continuously called to try to get information over the next week! Was lied to several times throughout the two weeks and one day for a radiator change! Wasn't even notified when they required another part.  On top of it, the manager/owner referred to me as a "damn Yankee". Great business savvy you moron. If you want over priced work, dishonesty, ignorant management this is the place for you. Honestly, the worst experience I've ever had at a car maintenance facility.

resp.text: Sorry, Mr. Suave, but we have no record of you ever being in our shop.  We take our reviews very seriously, but you must have us confused with another shop.

The staff at World Class Auto make me feel welcome, comfortable and always take the time to explain why my car needs a certain repair, what options I have and the timeframe of repair urgency. The repair and ownership team take the time to get to know you and always listen to what I think is going on with my car. Hands down I wouldn't take my car any other place in the Birmingham area for regular maintenance to more complex projects.

Most of the service I have received is on a 2005 BMW x3. They are helping me keep it rolling in good shape.

name: James McCain
text: You drop your car off seven or eight days later no one calls you they tell your car is done and it cost $2000 to fix they fix my car with no approval I said OK paid the bill picked it up less than 10 days later I start to hear funky noise like something is loose then transmission fluid starts pouring all out of it  end it won’t move they send a wrecker after it same thing car sits there for almost 4 weeks no one calls me tells me the car is done I come to pick it up drive home put about 400 miles on it guess what car won’t move call him they tell me to bring it in don’t even offer it to tow it back wake they came and got it finally Repeated the same thing 3Weeks later I called to check on my car how they say it’s ready to go said they had a fluid leak told me that park the car out front I come to pick it up it’s dark and raining guess what the car won’t start won’t crank nothing popped the hood the negative battery cable was loose reconnect it car still is dead as a hammer. It’s late it’s dark come back the next day car won’t even jumpstart the battery is so dead go to get a battery put a battery in it started and the emergency brake light won’t go off like they adjusted the emergency break wrong drive it home will never go back oh by the way when I went to pick it up the driver side floor board was full mud . Don’t take your car there

name: Leah Autumn
text: I contacted Alabama Precision Transmission to get an estimate on a new transmission for my Nissan. I spoke with Michael (Mike) and he worked hard and got me the best deal possible! He went above and beyond to get me what I needed and I would never go anywhere else!

name: Marshall Mims
text: Great guys to work with, great attention to detail and take pride in their work.

name: Kaitlyn Shotwell
text:
My car broke down about 20 miles south of Montgomery, and the Firestone on Maxwell AFB recommended this place as a reputable transmission specialist. My first impression walking in was not favorable, as the owners smoke indoors and it is not well maintained. I would say the highlight of this place is the employees, because they were super helpful and polite as my car was put into the garage. Be careful if you have insurance; once I brought up that my insurance might cover the work, the owner got really shady and kept telling me that it wasn't a good idea to contact my insurance company. I ended up leaving my car here for about a week and I heard no updates from the store and they wouldn't answer any phone calls. I decided I didn't want to conduct business with these folks anymore. When I finally got the owner on the phone, he protested that the job would cost me about $6,000, but calling around and showing the invoice to other mechanics in the area, they told me they would do the same job for about $4,000. I ended up having the car towed to the dealership because of the bad vibes I got with APT.

In summary, I cannot attest to their expertise fixing the car, but I definitely didn't like their low level of professionalism. Two and a half stars.

text: They are absolutely wonderful! I took in my Dad’s 1993 Ford Lightning. We had been having trouble with it going dead and just not running right. Amazing customer service!  A+!  I will be using them for the service of my car.

text: I grew up next door to Jeff. I remember a day when I looked out and saw a 2nd gen camaro with a blower sitting a foot out of the hood. It was Jeff. I was a kid and did the burnout hand signal..to which he happily obliged. Worked with his lil sis many years later and he still remembered. Genuinely thoughtful and kind dude who exudes knowledge.

name: Bailey Ike
text: The customer service is outstanding, the people working there feel authentic and give the impression they truly care.

name: Radioman
text:
Jeff @ HESCO is unparalleled in his infinite wisdom behind the wheel and under the hood of a car. He has been known to pull a rabbit out of a hat on many occasions. I would not hesitate to take any of my vehicles to him for any reason.
Thanks, Jeff-
Tim @ Rickwood Radio Service

name: Eric Morin
text: At last found a shop to work on my Mazda RX-8 R3 with a twin rotary. Honest diagnosis and job well done. Think it runs better than when I bought it! Thank you Jeff and crew!

resp.text: Thank you for the outstanding feedback, Eric! We are so glad that you were able to find a shop that fit your auto needs, we look forward to working with you and your RX-8 again!

text: I have been taking my machine work to Hesco for many years. Best machine shop anywhere. Now that I no longer work on my own vehicles, I intend to entrust them with their care.

name: Nichole Posten
text: As someone indicated, they do a lot of specialty high end vehicle work but it has been well worth the extra to know that the work is done right.  I have been taking my now 10yr old (beater) Jeep here for 8+ years and will take my new Subaru here.  Joe is great and always has the time to spend explaining anything to you.  He even took my husband and son around the shops to look at all of the cars there.

resp.text: Thank you for your loyalty over the years Nichole, we truly appreciate it!

name: Stephen Wilson
text: These guys do some of the best work in Birmingham. That being said, when you see the Ferraris and classic cars in the parking lot you know you are going to pay a price that matches their level of quality work. Don't let the abrasive or lack of communication keep you from at least getting a written quote from their shop. On a side note, get someone to show you around their facility because it is basically an ever changing museum of mechanical genius. Custom builds, daily drivers, etc it's a pretty cool spot in the heart of downtown. If all else fails, you can walk to Good People Brewery or Regions Park  and drink away your sorrows.

resp.text: Thank you for the good review, Stephen! We appreciate getting your feedback and we hope next time we can deliver a 5-star experience!

name: Lindsay Hobbs
text:
I have nothing but good things to say about Hesco and the people working there! My husband and I were driving from Utah to Atlanta when our car broke down in Birmingham. Even though they were busy, they fit us in and got us back on the road the next day! Not only did they fix our car, but they went above and beyond to make sure that we were taken care of while we were stuck in the city. They even called us a few days later to make sure we had made it to our destination safely and without any problems!
We are SO grateful for Jeff, Joe, and everyone else who took such good care of us! This was by far the best experience we have ever had with a mechanic, and would recommend them to anyone!

resp.text: Thank you for the excellent review, Lindsay! We are glad you arrived safely, and we can't thank you enough for all the kind words. Our goal is to provide our customers with an unbeatable experience every time!

name: Prentice Jones
text: One of my best friends works at this shop so I know they are an A+ shop because Warren is a very good tech.

resp.text: Thank you for the awesome review! We are so glad to have Warren on our team! We appreciate the great recommendation!

name: Jacob Hobbs
text: These are the kind of guys that would take their shirts off their backs to help you. Highly recommend to anyone who appreciates honest and high quality work!

resp.text: We appreciate the great review, Jacob. That is exactly who we strive to be. Thank you for your business, and we hope to see you again!

name: James Gavin
text: On a recent trip from Birmingham back to Atlanta my 2012 Hyundai Equus ran hot about 30 miles outside of Birmingham, we got off at exit 147 wound up having to get it towed back to Birmingham. I didn't know a mechanic in B'ham so I had it delivered to J.B. a Buick dealership, they inspected it for $309 and said that I at the least had a blown head gasket caused by a bad water pump and that it was going to cost me $2215  for them to break down the engine and make sure that there was no further damage with the engine,  and that it could be as much as $4500 to replace all the gaskets through out the engine. NOT TODAY!!! So I did a Google search and came across HESCO, the reviews were great, I spoke with Joe Molina and he arranged to have it tower to HESCO "DESPITE being in the middle of changing locations", they got it in checked it out, started it up, "No white smoke from the tail pipe", turned out to be the water pump, THAT's ALL. I can't recommend Joe Molina and the guys at HESCO Automotive highly enough, they are highly professional, extremely efficient, keep you informed at every juncture of the process, and very reasonable. I am telling ALL my friends and family to take their vehicles to HESCO Automotive. Thanks guys, this was a very stressful situation as I was having to take care of it from Atlanta, Joe you could not have been better.

resp.text: Thank you James! It is great to hear from you and glad we could help you out.  We want to make sure all of our costumes are taken care of and are aware of the repairs needed for their vehicle. We are glad you found us and we could located the problem to your water pump. We truly appreciate your recommendation. Give us a call if you have questions or need anything in the future!

name: Ron Denney
text: I had a bolt sheared off inside my BMW motorcycle wheel. I called Wesco from Hoover and explained the situation and that I lived 90 miles south in Dadeville, AL. I spoke with Joe on the phone. He said bring it in and they would see what they could do for me. They used an easy out to remove the bolt for me quickly and wouldn't even take any money for this service. Great people at WESCO!

resp.text: We really appreciate the excellent review, Ron. We are happy to help. Let us know if there is anything else we can help you with!

name: Ray Clark
text: I have a Z-3 and a 535i and would not let anyone else touch them in Birmingham.  I used to go to Tom Williams for items under warranty and they always found something to fix that did not need fixing.  Anything Joe, Jeff and his folks say, I trust completely.

resp.text: Ray - We cannot thank you enough for your business and the great review! We appreciate being able to work with you.

name: Dawn Brook
text: I took my wife's 07 Murano in for a few repairs and got the same great service as all the exotics Hesco works on. Great guys and service.

resp.text: Roy - Thank you for the great review! It is always a pleasure to be able to work with you and we cannot thank you enough for your business.

name: Katie munkus
text: I was very disappointed with this business. I had to have my car towed here the Wednesday before Thanksgiving. I was told that I would get a detailed estimate the following Monday. I was fine with that. When I called Monday I was told that they had already started replacing and fixing the damaged parts to my car without my permission and without my knowledge. So I specifically said please stop working on it until I get the detailed estimate I was promised and had looked it over. The next day I decided to have my car towed to a different shop that specializes in Volkswagen and Audi cars. When I called Hesco to tell them what I had decided they informed me that my car was almost completely finished. The owner made a decision without my permission yet again and without calling to inform me what was going on. I was highly disappointed that every decision made about my car was made without my input or knowledge. And that my request for them to stop the repairs was completely ignored. This business is very unprofessional and lacks the ability to communicate with their customers. I also feel that I was taken advantage of because I am a woman. Not to mention the repairs done to my car were done wrong. I ended up having to have all the transmission fluid drained and replaced bc they used a brand that is not recommended for German cars. I also had to have the tires rebalanced and aligned bc Hesco didn't properly do that either. I do not recommend this business to anyone.

name: Douglas Smith
text: Apparently Jim Burke Subaru won't work on modified Subaru's (so basically every WRX)... Hesco came through and even purchased the updated software so that they could diagnose my car. Skip Jim Burke and take your modified Subie here.

resp.text: Thank you for the great feedback Douglas, we are glad we were able to help when others fell short.

name: T Adams
text: These guys are truly great!

resp.text: Thank you, Rai for the 5-stars and kind words! We greatly appreciate it.

name: John Waldo
text: Don't take your Eaton supercharged vehicle here.

name: André Garcia
text:
It's ok for the price.  However the reason they don't get the extra 3 stars is because they are always trying to sell you stuff you don't need, which is why I stooped coming back to this place before. Decided to give it a try and it was the same think.

The service guy called me in the garage to show me "something on my car".  He had the air filter open and he pointed to it and pointed to my EXHAUST MANIFOLD and told me that my injectors and inside "there" was full of  "gunk" and that I needed a fuel injector cleaning for $59.   FIRST, the fuel injectors are NOT inside the EXHAUST MANIFOLD or the air filter.  Second, unless you took apart my valve cover you HAVE NO IDEA how clean/dirty my injectors are.  My car is fairly new which quite low mileage and very well maintained,  don't try to scam me into something that I DON'T need,  or even if I did you wouldn't know simply by pointing to my Exhaust Manifold.

There is a good reason the place across the street "Firestone" was packed with people and they are more expansive and this place was empty.  It's called HONESTY.

resp.text:
Dear André,
We are sorry your last visit to our auto shop did not meet your expectations. Our staff is well trained to identify maintenance issues on each vehicle we diagnose. We are a family owned honest, friendly, and affordable auto maintenance shop. We'd greatly appreciate the opportunity to discuss your concerns further, in hopes of reaching a positive resolution. Please contact one of the owners at your earliest convenience, in hopes of making this right with you. Thank you!
~ Jamie and Rick Martin, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham
(205) 637-5523

name: Jade Howlet
text: I never had an experience so BAD! I get my tires rotated and oil changed. I come back to get the same services done. The mechanic tells me whoever rotated my tires last stripped my lug nut post. When they realize they were the ones who did it they tell me I need to sign a waiver for them to try to fix it or pay for a whole new post! I will never be back!

resp.text:
Dear Jade,
We really appreciate our customers and continuously strive to provide excellent customer service. Our records do not show you as a client of ours. Is there a possibility the transaction is under a different name? We are happy to discuss any issues you might have with your vehicle and try to reach a reasonable solution.
Please give us a call at (205) 637-5523 at your earliest convenience. Thank you!
~ Jamie and Rick Martin, Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Trent Daniels
text: Front desk lady was very nice. The gentleman working on my truck was very informative. I always come here for an oil change, doesnt take long at all. You cant beat these prices

resp.text:
Dear Trent,
We wanted to say a big "thanks" for your nice review. We will certainly pass along the compliments to our staff. We enjoy taking great care of our customers by delivering affordable pricing and efficient services. Customers like you make our jobs rewarding and enjoyable. Thank you!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Justin McClew
text: Nice people that don't do nice work. Took it for the premium oil change. Told me all the belts and hoses looked good, air filter was good everything is topped off, but my radiator was leaking. Soon as I left there was a big vibration in it... Let the car sit for 3days, both radiator hoses needed to be replaced, leaking because of corrosion, the air filter was horrible, the pcv valve was clogged, power steering that doesn't leak was empty and the vibration was because they put 2 quarts more oil than the engine was supposed to have!! Quoted me a price to get a radiator when it was a hose they told me was good!

name: monica mitchell
text: I am sitting here now for the third time since a tune up and oil change last week. As soon as I drive off I noticed my car was missing in a cylinder. Had to come back and get a coil replaced immediately. Also my power steering fluid was extremely low and my coolant level was low. once again drove off and noticed oil burning. I couldn't come right back but came back a few days later and it was the plug gasket. So either it wasn't checked when the oil was drained or the tightest plug too tight. Once again even left after gasket replace and car is still burning oil. Now it smokes too. Telling me it's the axle boot which is messed up but none of this began until immediately after I've left from getting service done here. I'm so disappointed because the last time I was here I had such a good experience I thought I had found my new spot to get work done on my car.

resp.text:
Dear Monica,
We are very sorry you are experiencing auto issues. We have checked our records and our auto center does not show the name used on the review as a customer at our auto shop. We would like to assist you in finding a positive resolution and ask that you give one of us a call at the number shown below. We are happy to talk with you at your earliest convenience. Thanks so much!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

(205) 637-5523

name: Kristyn Taylor
text: I drive all the way from Southside to bring my car here. They are faster than that express place, at half the price but with better service.  The last time I was there, the tech noticed how terrible my headlights were and let me know they were running a special to fix them for just $20. Now I don't have to drive with my brights on!

name: Mrs. Williams
text: DO NOT TAKE YOUR CAR HERE!!! I REPEAT!! SAVE YOUR CAR AND MONEY AND GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!! My husband took his Classic Car here for an detailed  job , after picking up the vehicle the following Monday it would not crank. Upon returning my husband was told that they will not be able to work on his car after receiving the money to fix the issue.

resp.text:
Dear Mrs. Williams,
We are saddened to read this review. Our staff has tried to work with your husband and his classic car in a patient, honest, and friendly manner. We feel like we have done everything we could to assist you and wish you all the best.
~Jamie and Rick Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Jeremy Hinton
text: They corrected several issues that left my car unsafe. They were fast, courteous and did a great job. I'll be recommending them to friends!

resp.text:
Dear Jeremy,
Thanks so much for posting the 5-star review of our auto services. It is so nice to read that you received fast and courteous auto repair services during your recent visit to our shop. The recommendations are greatly appreciated and we look forward to seeing you again. All the best!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Drew Cottrell
text: Ive heard this location has been shut down but ive been here recently, great service

resp.text:
Hello Drew,
Your patronage at our auto center is greatly appreciated. Thanks for the compliment on our auto services.

You are correct, we have closed this location and plan to relocate about 25 miles away close to Finley Avenue and Farmers Market. We also have a Precision Tune Auto Care center in Alabaster, which is only 6 miles away from our old Pelham shop.

We hope to see you again so we can continue providing you with excellent auto maintenance services. Thank you!
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: D F
text: They test the cars they service by flying up and down hilltop business dr as fast as they can.

resp.text:
Dear Drew,
Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We too have noticed that there seems to be a lot of vehicles driving faster than they should on Hilltop Drive. Please know that we have addressed this concern with  our employees and have emphasized how important it is to follow the speed limit at all times. Safety is our number one concern in our shop, and also as we test drive any vehicles. If you have any additional questions, or concerns, please feel free to call the store manager, Kevin Gainey, at (205) 637-5523. Thank you very much!

name: Amy Lynn Butler
text: I WAS a long time client until this weekend when they over charged us (found out too late after spending over $650!!) & my husband gave them instructions to leave our car locked outside of their shop, for us to pick up, since we couldn't come until after they were closed. Not only was our car not outside for us, it was still on the rack with the hood up in the shop!! We had to back track to our house & my husband was late for his job! We are VERY disappointed. We have literally spent thousands there through the years. And we are done.

name: Jennifer Cargile
text:
My husband went in with his CRV on a Saturday about 9am for a normal oil change and a check engine light, was told that he needed some spark plugs and new oil pan gasket (there were NO oil leaks that we had noticed, and we were told it was loosing 80% of its oil) and was told it wouldn't take long at all, maybe an hour,  well he didn't leave until after 12 (receipt said 1217). He asked multiple times if it was ready, was told only 20 more mins, then 30...well 2 hours after the said time he left. We had plans at 11am, so those didn't happen WHICH could have been planned for-like loading up my kids (one being a newborn) in the car and picking him up. No apologies for the extra wait time and never honest about how long it was going to take.
Come that following week, SURPRISE, there was an oil leak on the garage floor AND the check engine light was back on. So we took it back once again. He was told that it was just old oil coming out and it was fine and that some other piece needed to be replaced for the check engine light. Like why wasn't this fixed the first time!? Unless we got super unlucky and something went wrong within the 3/4 day time.

Well now it's about 4 months later and there's still oil spots on the floor!
So we called today, I got a so-so person on the phone and was told to bring it back in, no "oh my goodness! That's not what we like to hear..please bring it back in!" It was just "bring it back".

1st, can we make the comparison on the comment from Ashton Morgan below?? This was the SAME day, the SAME time and my husband remembers talking and waiting with Ashton.
We aren't very knowledgable on car repairs and we should've gotten a 2nd opinion(the Garage in Pelham is literally walking distance and everyone always has great things to say about them, but this was just for a cheap oil change-never again!) ..but we just had a baby and didn't have much spare time or sleep to decide these things with a clear mind.

I just reccomend going somewhere else for piece of mind EVEN for an oil change, even if this was just a random bad day (which look at the rating-use your brains people! We didn't and now we're paying for it with our time and now a nasty driveway and garage floor) for the people working on cars, there has yet to be a verbal apology-and now if we get one it will just seem forced.

resp.text:
Dear Jennifer,
My name is Rick and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham. We wanted to apologize for the long wait during your last visit with us. We know our customers time is valuable and we always strive to provide a reasonable time estimate on each service we perform. I can assure you we addressed the waiting issue and are thrilled to have a new store manager.

Our records show we serviced your vehicle in early February 2016. We offer a 12-month warranty on all services and encourage you to contact us at (205) 637-5523 to set up a follow-up appointment. Since your vehicle has over 189,000 miles on it, there may be another leak requiring some attention. We look forward to making this right with you. Thank you!

name: Michelle Thompson
text: Quick oil change! Very nice staff!!

resp.text: Thank you for choosing our auto shop for your recent oil change, Ms. Thompson. We love our customers and appreciate your business very much. We look forward to seeing you again for any of your other car care needs.  ~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Jarrard Blanco
text: Very prompt service and a knowledgeable, courteous staff.

resp.text:
Dear Jarrard,
It is great to read that our staff was able to provide you with prompt and knowledgeable auto repair services, topped off with great customer service. We look forward to your next visit. Thank you for your business!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Michael Johnson
text: My wife took her SUV here last week for oil change and now I have oil puddles all over my driveway!!!!!

resp.text:
Dear Michael,

We apologize for your mishap regarding your recent visit to Precision Tune Auto Care, Hilltop.  It is our goal to make sure each person has a positive experience with us.  It's customers like you that help us to make adjustments in our shops, to better serve you and other customers.  This has been pointed out to the employees so this doesn't happen again.  We are sorry for what happened and we thank you for your feedback.

Sincerely,
Rick Martin
205-637-5523

name: Osman Miranda
text: Is a pretty nice place!!

name: Christine Norris
text: So friendly and helpful!

resp.text: Thank you very much for the 5-star review of our auto center, Christine! Your business is appreciated and we are always glad to provide you with friendly and helpful auto services. All the best to you!  ~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: juan pardo
text: Great work and fast!

name: Rachel McGuff
text: Quick and affordable.

resp.text:
Dear Rachel,
We are so happy to read that your recent visit to our auto shop provided you with quick and affordable services. We love happy customers and wanted to thank you for your business. Cheers!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Lindsey R Swinford
text: Great service!

resp.text:
Dear Lindsey,
Thanks so much for your kind review of our auto services. We appreciate you taking the time to post it for our shop!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Zac Martin
text: Great service

resp.text: Thanks so much, Zac, for this 5-star rating of our auto shop. We appreciate your business very much. ~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Mike Menendez
text: nice people

name: Candy Marbrey
text: EXCELLENT

resp.text: Ms. Marbrey - Thank you for visiting our auto shop for your recent maintenance. It was our pleasure to provide you with excellent customer service. ~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Curtis Bowden
text: Great service! Was able to get my car checked and repaired in the same day.

name: The Mr. Franklin
text: Took about 3 weeks to get my part but once arrived fixed my vehicle in 45mins did a good job

name: Paul Booker
text: Had an issues with a taillight and tag lights being out. They were able to locate a short and replaced a fuse. I felt they were very reasonably priced, upfront and honest.

name: steven elliott
text: I am employed here.. Great place to be.

name: Sophia Johnson
text: Very slow

name: Ken Klispie
text: Excellent service! The team at Guthrie's did a thorough inspection of our new/used minivan after it started making various intermittent sounds from a long cross country drive. They were able to pinpoint several issues that were small but would have left us stranded on our next big trip. Quick, very reasonable and communicative through the repairs. We did our next long trip without any issues or noises. We know where we will be taking all of our cars for service, thank you!

resp.text: Thank you, Ken for the review. We appreciate your business. We are happy to help with your automotive needs. Welcome to Alabama!!!

name: Steven Richardson
text: We were traveling through Alabama and my pickup broke down right off the 310 Cullom exit. The tow truck driver recommended Guthrie.  We were nervous not knowing anyone but were pleasantly surprised. We received text updates and a phone call to explain what needed to be done.  They exceeded our expectation completing the job quickly and at a fair price. Highly recommend their auto shop. God Bless.

resp.text: Thank you for the review Steven. We appreciate your kind words. We always try to get people back on the road. I know what it is like to be broken down on the road. Especially if you are on a schedule. Thank you so much for choosing Guthrie's Auto Service.

name: Michael Blair
text: Our car started experiencing some pretty severe issues on our drive home to Tennessee from Florida. We genuinely could not have chosen a better exit to pull over at! We pulled Guthrie's Auto up on our Maps and decided to take our car over there. Despite how busy they were, they were very understanding that we were from out of town and immediately got to work on our vehicle and offered recommendations on places to eat around since we had to wait several hours! Absolutely awesome service!

resp.text: We appreciate your words, and the 5 stars. We strive to give everyone a 5 star experience and help them along their way. Thanks again. Terry Guthrie

name: Victor Cornell
text: I've taken my cars there several times and always got good professional service which was reasonably priced.

resp.text: Thank you Victor, we appreciate your business. Terry

name: teresa cobbs
text: Great people. Keep you updated on progress and prices. Very trustworthy.

resp.text: Thank you Teresa, we appreciate your business and kind words. Terry

name: Barbara
text:
A Great Place/Great People... Our truck broke down & Triple A couldn’t have found a better place to take it to! They took us to our hotel & picked us back up....The owner went above & beyond to get our truck fixed so we could be back on the road this morning! Truck is running great again! Thank You So much for not only getting our truck fixed but for your kind & thoughtfulness.
Rick, Barbara & LACI

resp.text: It was a pleasure to meet you two. I was happy to help you all with your F-250 diesel. Glad you were able to get back on the road any get out of the flooding that we had that day. We were safe but got a lot of rain that day. Thanks again for letting us to serve you.

name: Janice McGahey
text: They got my car fixed in no time flat. The cost was super reasonable. And it’s been several weeks everything is running perfectly. I would highly recommend Terry and his crew!!

resp.text: Janice, thank you for your review! We're glad we could provide a quality auto repair service for you and we'll see you soon!

name: La Donna Griffin
text: I received very good service, both times I brought my car to Guthrie's.  Very nice employees., and patient with the questions I ask.  I'll be back.  I've recommended Guthrie's to a few people.

resp.text: Thank you La Donna for the 4 stars. We hoped to give you a 5 star experience when we serviced your Kia. Maybe next time. We do appreciate you trusting us with your vehicle. Terry Guthrie

name: Page Sparks
text: A couple years ago my car was really in a bad way, and took it to the dealership. They were going to charge me $1500 for my repair. I despaired and reached out to friends and family for recommendations. A good friend recommended Guthrie's, said they always did good work. So I called them up. For the same repair they were going to have to charge close to $900. It was better but still hurt. Took my car up and waited. Got a call from Mike and he said that he wanted to check over the car before I spent all that money. He discovered what the dealership didn't, that something was just unplugged. Only charged the diagnostic fee! He could have charged me fully, but he and this business have been ethical. I take my car to them anytime I have issues, and they've been precise and sure every time. Would highly recommend for anyone who's been burned by bad mechanics.

resp.text: Page, thank you for your review. We were happy to have been able to help you out with your vehicle and to save you money. We appreciate having you as a customer and we look forward to seeing you next time!

name: Hustle Hard Fitness
text: Very caring and reliable crew Terry and them have always took care of our car needs and always does a fantastic job! Great prices and they get it done it a timely manner

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review! We'll continue to provide a caring and reliable atmosphere for your auto repair needs and we look forward to helping you in the future!

name: Felicia Wright
text: Took my vehicle to have my AC looked at. They were very friendly and knowledgeable. Seemed to want to help me more than just make a dollar. They have a text system set up that notifies you when your vehicle is being worked on. The owner follows up with you a day or so after you pick up your vehicle to be sure everything is going well. Very personable business.

resp.text: Felicia, thank you for your review! We're happy to have looked at your A/C and we'll continue to be friendly and knowledgeable.

name: John Thomas
text: Broke down while traveling. They was very helpful and willing to get our truck repaired at very reasonable rates. I highly recommend Guthrie's Auto Service.

resp.text: John, thank you for your review, we hope you had safe traveling after visiting our auto repair shop, and please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you!

name: Bettie Burnett
text: Had car towed to Guthrie's for repair on coolant system. Had been told by two regular customers that they do really good work. The office attendant (Mike, I think was his name), was straight-forward, respectful, patient, gave me a phone quote, had the work done timely, with the final bill ending up being a little less than the original quote, even after adding the tow bill & taxes. It was a very welcomed change from the experience I'd had at another local shop I'd been referred to (but later warned about from several other past customers) where I repeatedly had to endure rudeness from the know-it-all mechanic, immediate breakdowns from same issue I'd just paid to have repaired, & ignored voicemails asking to speak to the owner. Guthrie's owner followed-up the very next day to make sure everything was going well with the work on my car. I would much rather pay for a job well done the first time than a little less and keep breaking down, having my car towed, finding another way to work at the last minute to keep my job, and then constantly being talked down to in person & over the phone (while the owner justifies it as him "being from New York",... to which I reminded them both that he's now n ALABAMA, & that cocky attitude won't do here, especially with me!!... 3 different types of repairs... never fixed after being told they were!). So, yes, I am very happy to give Guthrie's a positive review, THANK YOU!

resp.text: Bettie, thank you for your review. We were happy to help out with your coolant system repair and we are glad to be respectful, honest, and patient for all of our customers. We are sorry you had a bad experience at a different shop, but thank you for trusting us to get the job done. See you later!

name: Randy Anderson
text: Took my '08 Tundra in for some pretty major repairs (stuck secondary air intake valve, timing belt replacement, pulley repair). I’m beyond pleased with the quality of the work, the affordable price, and the speed of service you guys gave me. I’m new to the area, and will be coming back to you guys for any vehicle work that I need, and I’ll make sure to tell everyone else I meet about you as well! Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Randy! We're glad we could help you out with your '08 Tundra repairs, and we'll continue to offer quality and affordable auto repair services, and we are excited to have you as our customer. See you next time!

name: hotrodford 88
text: Great people to deal with.

name: Jeffrey Stevens
text: They were AAA approved brought truck in for water pump replacement they repaired it in a timely manner and did a over all inspection people were very friendly

resp.text: Jeffrey, thank you for your leaving us a review. We're glad to have helped you out and let us know if there anything we can do for you!

name: Cheryl Masterson
text: I was traveling thru Cullman car wouldn't start.  They repaired it same day. What a blessing, excellent service.

resp.text: Cheryl, we're so glad we could help you out while you were traveling through Cullman. Thank you for trusting us with your auto repair needs!

name: Mark Maddox
text: My truck needed help. I planned on it being in the shop for 7 to 10 days. I dropped it off on a Monday afternoon, and received a call on Friday afternoon that it was ready. Never did I think anyone could repair or replace as many things as Guthrie's did in such a short time. I left Guthrie's and drove to Gulf Shores. The true test, interstate highway's in Alabama. They did a great job. No vibration, shaking, or leaking. Awesome job guys. Thanks.

resp.text: Mark, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! Here at Guthrie's Auto Service, we understand how important your vehicle is to you. That is why we always strive to provide quality care in a timely manner. It was a pleasure to work on your truck and we're thrilled to hear that your drive to Gulf Shores was smooth. We look forward to your next visit!

name: Jason Bookout
text: We were from out of town and our car broke down late on a Friday afternoon. Terry the owner fixed our busted coolant hose and had us back on the road in less than 2 hours for a fair price. He did not take advantage of a situation where we had no other choice.  I have later heard from other friends in the area that Terry does great work. Would highly recommend if you are in the area.

resp.text: Jason, we appreciate your kind review and were happy to assist with your coolant hose. We understand how frustrating it can be to deal with vehicle issues when you are out of town, so we were glad we could fix it quickly so you can be on your way. Thank you and please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you in the future!

name: tanya roberson
text: Very courteous, professional, high quality service! They solved our overheating issue and fixed it Fast! Highly recommend!! Best auto service in Cullman!!

resp.text: Tanya, thank you for your review! We're excited to continue to be courteous, professional, and provide high quality service! Looking forward to seeing you next time!

name: Xochitl Robinson
text: Terry was very helpful and pleasant.I went there to have an stimate on a problem that I have in my SUV. The place is very clean.prices are reasonable. Thanks Terry.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We appreciate your support of our auto repair shop!

name: Justin Nichols
text: Needed help tracking a power draw draining my battery, they found it and got everything sorted very quickly. I was very pleased with the service and I will absolutely use them for future repairs.

resp.text: Justin, thank you for your review! We're glad we could be here to help with your battery, and we'll look forward to seeing you next time in our auto repair shop!

name: Douglas Ballenger
text:
I was really surprised by the service and friendliness of Guthries auto service, after I spent 2 weeks working on my vehicle with no luck finding the problem I decided to find a shop to work on it. A friend of mine recommended Guthries. Some of problems I was having with my vehicle was, lost power to all of my windows, lost power to my rear view mirror and backup camera, blown bulb in taillights, short causing battery to drain, could not turn ignition switch All the way off so I couldn’t get key out 🤔😂 but the power door lock still worked!!
But don’t lock them if you have something draining your battery ! 🙃 Seriously Guthries will be my go to from now on ! Very friendly service, very knowledgeable and very fair service pricing!! I’m not going to say what my vehicle problem was ask Mike when you take your vehicle 🚗 in.

To all at Guthries auto service,

Thank you 🙏

resp.text: Douglas, we appreciate your kind review. We were more than happy to help you out of a tricky situation with your vehicle, and we'll continue to be friendly, knowledgeable, and fair-priced for your future visits. Thank you and we'll see you again!

name: Marie Lindsey
text: Great service and repairs. Called me as they found issues and got my approval before all repairs. Even checked with me the next day to make sure everything was working. I will take my other vehicles there for any service or repairs. Very satisfied customer!

resp.text: Thank you for the great feedback, Marie! Our goal is to provide quality repairs to all of our customers along with excellent communication to keep our customers in the loop. We look forward to working with you again in the future.

name: Emily Taylor
text: I've used this shop for a number of repairs on my older vehicle now. Their prices are fair, the staff are all friendly and knowledgeable, and they are very expedient! I never have to wait long when I call, they're usually able to schedule my repair for the same week, and they always complete my repair in less time than expected.  They also send valuable customer loyalty coupons!

resp.text: Emily, we are glad to have you as a customer in our shop. We will continue to offer fair prices, friendly and quality service, and timely. We look forward to your next visit to our shop!

name: Gregg Loney
text: Long story as short as possible! I’m driving from Orlando to Las Vegas with a car load and 3 pets. I drove in with my car acting up and they went right to work. They kept me updated with the progress and about 2 days later I had my car back in perfect working ordering! I have no idea what this kind of work is worth with parts and labor but having peace of mind is worth it all.

resp.text: Gregg, we are so happy that we were able to get you back on the road quickly in a vehicle that will get you to your destination! Providing our great customers the peace of mind to travel cross-country is so important to us!

name: Paw Paw John
text: Guthrie's Auto Service is very reliable, honest and friendly. They always called for approval with a price quote before performing any work. I highly recommend Terry and his crew for all of your auto service needs.

resp.text: We appreciate the 5-star review and we are glad to be reliable, honest, and friendly. We look forward to having you back in our auto repair shop!

name: Rachel Dawsey
text: Guthrie's Auto is great to work with!  They keep our cars running and are very personable and friendly!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Rachel! We are glad to have you as a customer, and we'll continue to be here for your automotive repair needs while being friendly and professional.

name: Joe Cook

text:
Called up there to schedule a drop off. Because they had good reviews. Not the friendliest person who answered the phone. That's fine but when I told him what was going on he said we dont do transmission work. My problem is it says they do on their website. Rude and waste of time. Going to add to the post I was discriminated against I guess because I'm a woman. my husband called the place and said exactly what I said the problem
Was and they told him yes they do that there.

resp.text: Hello Mrs. Oliver. We do not rebuild transmissions, but we do remove and replace transmissions with either used transmissions or remanufactured transmissions. A gentleman called yesterday and obtained a price to replace the torque convertor. I am not sure if this was your husband or not, but we can replace a torque convertor because it is physically attached to the transmission and is not an internal part. I believe there may have been some miscommunication as to what was required to repair the vehicle/transmission. Alabaster Automotive, LLC prides itself in servicing EVERYONE in the community and we do not discriminate against anyone based on sex, ethnicity, religion, etc. If you would like to discuss this matter further, please feel free to reach out to me with a phone call. Thank you.

Fantastic service !

name: Andrae Antwoine
text: They explain, very professional, but not accountable for any mistakes.  I have 4 kids and wife, the expense was necessary..they had to replace spark plugs, explained that if removed, Its a possibility some will break off...well 1 got stuck in the engine.....it requires taking everything out and restructure how it was before...with no mistakes...so it took 2-3 weeks to get it done...after 3100$ mechanic informed us #1 he drove the car 65 miles testing the truck..no gas reimbursement (not considering our financial needs)....#2.that our sensor light was not working, (but we never had an issue with it),they didn't charge us for replacing it, but now it  ironically reads an alternator light.  #3 The mechanic simply said, i don't know why it came on, but it needs to be replaced. Although, your safe to drive it home.   #4. 2 weeks later, a great amount of smoke begins to shoot out exhaust...that very day, I took it to another auto place to get it assessed. (my red flags were to much).The other repair shop did not go into detail, but towed it back to alabaster, free of charge told them the issue and Alabaster Auto's  said "we'll give them a call".  #5 2 days later, I called them...ask "what is the problem?" they replied: The fluid injectors ironically messed up within 2 weeks, causing oil to spill onto the motor, "washing it out"...not only did they tell me an alternator was needed, but now I have to buy a new motor. Their excuse was....this is all a coincidences. they don't know why these thing are happening to my ford expedition that is under 120,000 miles. I called the other auto store to come and get it...I'll pay them what is necessary, but I am not spending another dime at alabaster Auto's.  We are taking legal action against them immediately after proof of fault. I can't except "it's all a coincidence".

resp.text: Andrae, one of our goals is to be honest and forthright with our customers. Also, we make every effort to ensure our customers are satisfied.  We deeply regret not being able to do so in your situation.

Do NOT aide this place. My CRV had to go in to have the fan assembly replaced. Upon getting it back I saw that my A/C no longer blew cold and my automatic window function no longer worked. Then, when taking it in to be looked at, I found that they BROKE what holds to coolant reservoir and just had it sitting, and it was empty. They had lost two of the caps on the front, AND they didn’t attach the grill back correctly.

I called them and they said to bring it in Saturday. I head that way and call them to tell them I’m on the way. And they inform me not to come Bc they are not able to do it Saturday and to come Monday. Isn’t an option for me. I paid $532 for them to essentially break my car. WILL never go back.

name: kevin armstrong
text: I came here to have a plug put in my trailer tire. I waited and was told to back my truck around. When i started backing in someone else whips in and i was forced to stop. He comes up to my window and tells me to wait just a minute and let him take care of this customer. I waited another 10-15 minutes. He finally plugs my tire, i pay and leave. I drive 1/2 Mile home. Get up the next morning and the tire is low again. I drive back down there and tell them something was wrong. There was one person in the lobby and he tells me the wait would be at least one hour to put air in my tire. name: Jacey B.
text:
I just want to start out by saying that the employees here all seem very genuine and caring, and they’re probably great with most vehicles. But do not bother taking any foreign vehicle to their shop that needs anything more than an oil change. I had a vehicle break down on me and took it here to avoid towing it to the dealership in Birmingham. I quickly received an estimate of almost $23,000 to fix my suv and was told that I should contact my insurance company because it was totaled.

I ended up taking it to the dealership for a second opinion (like I should have to begin with) and ended up only paying $3700 to repair what was wrong with my suv, and that didn’t include a single thing listed on the original estimate sent to me by CBA.

I really wish they would have just turned me away before I took it there in the first place if they could not service my vehicle instead of guessing what the problem was and writing it off as a lost cause.

I called CBA last week to update them on the status of my vehicle and to let them know what really was wrong with it - all they wanted to know was how “reputable the shop was that I took my vehicle to” and to try to tell me that they never referred to my car as totaled. Not only did they put us in a horrible situation, they also tried to act like they never said the things they did and asked what exactly I was expecting from my phone call. Just a bad experience.

resp.text: We apologize for your inconvenience, Jacey. Your feedback is appreciated, and we wish you well with all your future automotive repairs and services. Respectfully, Christian Brothers Montgomery

name: UpInTheAir
text:
I'd like to start off this review by saying that the folks at CBA Montgomery are incredibly polite and courteous. I have no disapproval towards the individual employees there.

With that said, that is unfortunately the extent of my positives about the business. I've brought two of my vehicles there a total of three times, over the course of two years, and each time, I have been disappointed. My first vehicle had a minor oil leak, and I took it to CBA to check it out. Long story short, they charged me over $1000 and a week of time, and in the end, the issue wasn't resolved. Brought my vehicle to another shop on Atl Highway, $250 later, and it was fixed. All in all, this wasn't a huge deal, but I was disappointed in CBA.

Fast forward 2 years, and i take another one of my vehicles that I had just purchased to CBA for a post-purchase full diagnosis (This alone cost $120) which they assured me would cover just about everything i needed to get done to the vehicle to get it to top shape. They quoted me over $5,000 worth of service. This alone wasn't completely insane. It was an older vehicle, and yes, a good few things needed fixing. However, I jotted down the items they told me I needed to replace and decided to do the items myself (brake change, coolant flush, oil change, filters, etc). Took off the brakes. The Pads, Rotors were literally brand new. They said my front caliper mount and caliper itself were in terrible condition. Completely false--it was in perfect condition upon further inspection. Performed the coolant change after they claimed it was dirty and needed changing (btw they quoted me $140 for the coolant change, which if you know, is one of the easiest things you can do yourself for $20 worth of coolant and 30 min of your time max). This also turned out to be unecessary. The coolant I drained was the exact same color as the new coolant I purchased myself. I did this for every item on the list of things they told me I needed to change, and the ONLY thing that actually needed to be changed was the front driver struts and the radiator fan.

A week after I get the $5000 list of things that need to be serviced, I drive to Atlanta. Halfway there on the interstate, my timing/fan belt shred apart, engine overheats, and my car is disabled. Tow it to a garage nearby and they inform me that my water pump was well on its way out, A/C compressor had imploded, and timing/fan belts should have been changed a long time ago. NONE OF THESE WERE MENTIONED BY CBA. Fortunately I did not get into an accident, but I trusted CBA to diagnose what I needed to fix on my vehicle, and they failed to mention, at all, three incredibly easy to inspect components that were failing, and caused my vehicle to stop driving in the middle of the highway. Absolutely unacceptable.

If you're reading this, CBA, come on, step your game up. If you're going to charge one of the highest rates in the entire state of Alabama, maybe provide service that backs up that rate. I respect you all as individuals, but  as a "reputable automotive service center", I am appalled.

resp.text: We take your detailed feedback seriously, as our customers' safety and satisfaction are very important to us. However, we are unable to find your information in our database so there is a chance you have left this for the wrong business. Please allow us an opportunity to address your concerns in detail by sending your phone number and availability to Eric.Wesch@cbauto.net. Thank you for your time, and we hope to hear from you soon. Respectfully, Christian Brothers Montgomery

text: I am very disappointed with how christian brothers does their service. I went to them to diagnose the problem with my Toyota Tacoma, they charged me $120 for a diagnostic. They drove my truck down the block and red lined it all the way back. Then after getting back said they can’t give a proper diagnosis since I had no exhaust on my truck because it was straight piped. Turned out to be a vacuum leak that I had fixed by another shop and they charged me nothing since it was just a loose hose. While they were doing my “diagnosis” as well they were trying to  charge a guy $1200 to fix a simple fuel pump on a tahoe. Ended up taking his tahoe to my house and got him driving again for only 200 dollars. Do not recommend this place if your in an emergency and trying to just get home.

resp.text: We are disappointed to receive your feedback, Hunter; however, we've done a thorough search of our database and are unable to find your and your vehicle's information. name: Echo McQueen
text:
There are not enough stars to rate this company.
2 weeks ago my car broke down, following a long string of misfortunes, I felt utterly hopeless and on the verge of just giving up. I came across the number to CBA while trying to find a repair shop that could quote me less than the few $1000 I had already been quoted by another. CBA was the only other shop I called, as soon as Danny answered my call he said he knew he had to help me, not to worry, they would do everything they could to get me through this. He did. He helped me get it towed from Prattville to their shop in Montgomery. Kept me updated every step of the way and constantly reassured me that they were there to help. My car, unfortunately, had some very major issues and even at CBA prices still was out of my price range. But, I didn't leave without transportation. Danny went above and beyond to help me find a suitable vehicle that I could afford and I left yesterday the owner of a reliable, running vehicle. The people of CBA are some of the kindest people I have had the blessing of meeting. They are truly doing works that reflect the epitome of Christians. Neither my family nor I will never not take a vehicle anywhere else other than Christian Brothers Automotive.
Thank you Danny and all the staff at CBA! I am forever grateful.

resp.text:
Being there for our customers when they need us is something our team takes great pride in, and it was truly our pleasure to be of help to you. Thank you very much for taking the time to share your great experience and acknowledge the diligent efforts of our team, and please know you can expect the same above and beyond service from us in the future.
Gratefully,
Christian Brothers Montgomery

text: Horrible service. I called them at 10:30 am to schedule a time to bring my vehicle in for an oil change. They told me to be there at 1:00 pm. I was there 10 minutes early. Finally after waiting a hour. They tell me they don't have have the oil filter to change my oil.

name: Joe Florida
text:
The name of this place really bothers me, and reminds me of the money changers in the temple. They are just using "Christian Brothers" for marketing purposes, not to show a genuine Christian nature. I went in for an alternator swap. I knew it was the alternator and told them as much; didn't stop them from charging me $48 to "diagnose" the problem. That was for an half hour of labor which if you want to count the time it took for them to tell me the price, was not a half hour after I brought it in. So yes, their hourly labor rate is $96 which strikes me as a little high, and yes, they don’t mind rounding up to the detriment of the customer. The rest of the bill was just as offensive and out of tune with normal auto repair prices. A re-manufactured alternator for my car was $117 at the time, they charged $244.20 and kept the core fee for themselves. No, they didn't put a new one in, just a re-man. They then charged me $39.78 for a serpentine belt, which I don't mind that they replaced, but a new one at any auto parts store runs around $20. So paying twice for parts is pretty painful, but then they add on a fee for "shop supplies"; I'm not sure what for, wear and tear on the tools? A paper towel or two? Whatever they were, they cost me $37.10. You'd think that "shop supplies" would be included when you pay premium for the parts and labor. On top of all of that, they padded the hours they were replacing the alternator. They charged me for 1.5 hours ($144.09) but the guy was only working on it for 45 minutes tops. The rest of the time that it was in their garage it just sat there. That's right, a car in Christian Brothers Automotive's garage is accruing labor costs even if it just sits there, hate to see what the overnight tab would be. Just think of the “shop supplies” that leaked into a car that sat there overnight.

They have three salesman upfront and only two technicians when I was there. This shows their focus: extract every possible penny from a potential customer, especially if he is from out of town. Why pay extra techs when you are still billing for the time that the car sits in their garage right? Another indication of their less-than-honest nature is that they put all these odd-ball prices on the parts and shop fees. Like what is with the 10 cents on shop supplies, they couldn't round that off? Well they could, but they don't want you to realize that they are just padding the bill. Ten cents looks more authentic. They also have a sign in the back that says: "Ask every customer: Is there anything else we can check for you today?" I'd hate to see the proposal for work you get back when you give these guys a greenlight to check out your entire car.

The technicians were good, the alternator seems to be working out fine. But the salesmen are only good at small talk. They brought my car back out of the garage and it started to smoke. They thought the engine was about to explode or something they turn it off and frantically check the oil. When I get out there they say that the oil pan is empty. Nope, check again. When they checked again they saw that it was half full like I knew it was. The smoke was from the debris that got knocked down onto the serpentine belt. Some debris that my $37.10 in shop supplies should have cleaned up. Guess not.

All-in-all, I paid $545 for a pretty simple fix, and they quoted me on the phone $250 as I was driving trying to get somewhere before my car died. I guess they knew they had me, but I hope this review saves somebody else the expense and frustration of dealing with these guys. These guys bend you over with a smile on their face. If you want this type of service and pay these type of prices, just go to the dealer, at least they are more knowledgeable about your car.

text:
If I could give negative stars I would. I dropped my 2005 Nissan Titian off to have some recall work completed, diagnostics ran, O2 sensors replaced and an oil change. I used one of their rental cars, as the truck would not be finished for several days. I left my truck, after giving them a budget of $1500.00, got on to the interstate and went about my day. I woke up in the morning and the car was not there. I talked it over with my roommate and we agreed i should call the police. Long story short, I tried calling Nissan to let them know the situation. I left several messages, tried calling my appointed service tech, sent an email and even had a conversation with the online chat. This happened Wednesday night- Thursday. I finally received a response, via email, stating my truck was finished. Total cost was just over $300.00. The recall work was covered, the cost was for the rental. All of the work I requested to have completed was not finished. The invoice didn't even reflect my request, the issues my truck is having or why I brought to them. In true honesty, they did complete the recall issues.
I will be staying with Benton Nissan or my personal mechanic, lesson learned.

name: Walt H
text:
My daughters '05 CR-V had a possible battery-drain/Charging system issue. Battery was dead after the car was sitting for 5 days. She got a jump and headed to Advanced-Auto. They replaced the battery (it needed to be replaced anyway) and then they did a charging system check - inconclusive...it *may* be the alternator .

This is when we  found Whitt's  - they confirmed it was not the charging system but rather a parasitic load on the system,  a 0.6A draw killed her battery over 5 days.  Whitt's found the offending culprit and we were out the door for less than $60.   Very pleased with their service.

resp.text: Thank You For The Great Review

text: Great service. Dropped my car off Monday morning, got a call that afternoon detailing what the problem was and the price for the fix, picked the car up Monday before 5. Did not try to up charge me, only fixed the problem I came in for. Will be coming here next time I need service.

Until now I found that Autozone can do it for free with exactly the same machine which itself cost less than $150. Lol. Very bad experience. Very blantant lie. I wouldn't trust these guys with anything. Your car is very important and car accident can cost your life so don't let liars touch it.

text: At first I thought they did a great job for a great price. My car wouldn't start and I wasn't sure why. I took it in and found out the battery cables were loose. They tightened them for me and told me I should probably get a new battery because the voltage was lower then it should be. But they tightened the cables so much so that it is IMPOSSIBLE to get them off to take the battery in for testing and even bent part of the battery cable. We tried forever to unhook it till the point that the cable broke with the nut still attached to the battery. So now we have to replace both the battery AND the cable. 0 stars for further breaking my car.
